18 Ex. <s>26<\s>. By subsequent trials it was found, <s>that<\s> by 
the use of an oil lamp, having 5 or 6 small wicks in a row, 
composed of Hempen packthread which produced a pale brownish 
light; that those singular fringes could be seen with nearly 
as much ease & certainty as any of the other phenomena, 
tho' not all at once; but by moveing the light over them, 
otherwise moveing the slips with respect to the light, & 
by using a magnifying glass it was ascertained, that the 
specimen represented by fig. 8<s>10<\s> contained 30 of these frin-
ges to an inch. Being uncertain whether they might not 
be the same as the primary Fringes mentioned in ex-
periment 11<s>18<\s> or a continuation of them, I caused a few of 
these latter to be formed at one end of the slips at A, 
fig. 8<s>10<\s> when it was found that they crossed each other 
at a certain angle as showen in the figure; therfore 
they could not be the same. moreover, as they have 
no perceptible colour like first primaries, nor divided 
into classes as Binaries; they must be different from either. 
19 Ex. <s>28<\s>. It next occurred to try what effect could be pro-
duced by three slips of glass when laid together, & pressed 
by their own weight alone. leaving them in this sit-
uation about 15 minutes I found an irregular set 
of Binaries spread over the surface of those slips; 
a representation of which is showen in fig. 9<s>11<\s> 
On drawing or sliding the upper piece of glass 
along the surface of the middle one, these fringes 
changed their shape, & disappeared as far as the 
middle slip was uncovered by the upper one; or if 
the upper two were kept together, & both moved 
over the surface of the under slip, the same pheno-
mena took place. But if the upper glass was in 
the smallest degree seperated from the other two, or 
if the two upper pieces were in the same degree sep-
erated from the lower one; in either case, the spect-
rums first changed their shapes & then vanished; 
but, on leaving the slips to the pressure of their 
own weight, were again as instantly restored.
